com.java.calumjohnston.algorithms

Class encodeData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.java.calumjohnston.algorithms.encodeData

  • public class encodeData
extends java.lang.Object
    Encode Class: This class implements the embedding of data into an image using one of several LSB techniques

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage encode(java.awt.image.BufferedImage coverImage,
                                           int algorithm,
                                           boolean red,
                                           boolean green,
                                           boolean blue,
                                           int redBits,
                                           int greenBits,
                                           int blueBits,
                                           boolean random,
                                           java.lang.String seed,
                                           java.lang.String text)
        Acts as central controller to encoding functions
        Parameters:
        coverImage - The image we will encode data into
        algorithm - The algorithm being used for encoding
        red - Determines whether the red colour channel will be used
        green - Determines whether the green colour channel will be used
        blue - Determines whether the blue colour channel will be used
        redBits - Number of LSBs to use in red colour channel
        greenBits - Number of LSBs to use in green colour channel
        blueBits - Number of LSBs to use in blue colour channel
        random - Determines whether random embedding has been used
        seed - The seed used to initialise the PRNG (if used)
        text - The data to be hidden within the image
        Returns:
        The image with the hidden data embedded into it

      • setupData

        public void setupData(java.awt.image.BufferedImage coverImage,
                      int algorithm,
                      boolean red,

                      int greenBits,
                      int blueBits,
                      boolean random,
                      java.lang.String seed)
        Sets up the initial data required for encoding
        Parameters:
        coverImage - The image we will encode data into
        algorithm - The algorithm being used for encoding
        red - Determines whether the red colour channel will be used
        green - Determines whether the green colour channel will be used
        blue - Determines whether the blue colour channel will be used
        redBits - Number of LSBs to use in red colour channel
        greenBits - Number of LSBs to use in green colour channel
        blueBits - Number of LSBs to use in blue colour channel
        random - Determines whether random embedding has been used
        seed - The seed used to initialise the PRNG (if used)

      • getColoursToConsider

        public int[] getColoursToConsider(boolean red,
                                  boolean green,
                                  boolean blue)
        Gets the colour channels that will be used
        Parameters:
        red - Determines whether the red colour channel will be used
        green - Determines whether the green colour channel will be used
        blue - Determines whether the blue colour channel will be used
        Returns:
        The colours that will be considered when encoding data

      • getLSBsToConsider

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getLSBsToConsider(int redBits,
                                                                int greenBits,
                                                                int blueBits,
                                                                boolean red,
                                                                boolean green,
                                                                boolean blue)
        Gets the LSBs that will be used for each colour
        Parameters:
        redBits - Number of LSBs to use in red colour channel
        greenBits - Number of LSBs to use in green colour channel
        blueBits - Number of LSBs to use in blue colour channel
        red - Determines whether the red colour channel will be used
        green - Determines whether the green colour channel will be used
        blue - Determines whether the blue colour channel will be used
        Returns:
        The LSBs that will be considered for each colour (same order as coloursToConsider)

      • getNextDataLSB

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getNextDataLSB(int[] firstPosition,
                                                 int currentColourPosition,
                                                 int currentLSBPosition,
                                                 boolean random)
        Gets the next pixel we should encode into
        Parameters:
        firstPosition - The positional data of the first pixel being considered
        currentColourPosition - The current position in coloursToConsider we are using
        random - Determines whether random embedding was used
        Returns:
        The order we should consider pixel whilst encoding

      • getNextDataLSBMR

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getNextDataLSBMR(int[] firstPosition,
                                                   int[] secondPosition,
                                                   int currentColourPosition,
                                                   boolean random)
        Gets the next two (consecutive) pixels we should encode in
        Parameters:
        firstPosition - The positional data of the first pixel being considered
        secondPosition - The positional data of the second pixel being considered
        currentColourPosition - The current position in coloursToConsider we are using
        random - Determines whether random embedding was used
        Returns:
        The order we should consider pixel whilst encoding

        public int[] generateNextPosition(int[] currentPosition,
                                  boolean random)
        Generates the next pixel position to consider when encoding data
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - The position which data has just been encoded
        random - Determines whether random embedding will be used or not
        Returns:
        The new position to consider

        Parameters:

        y - y coordinate of pixel
        colourChannel - The colour channel we are considering (R, G or B)
        Returns:

      • updateColourLSB

        public int updateColourLSB(int colour,
                           char data,
                           int position)
        Inserts data into a defined significant bit of the colour (LSB replace style)
        Parameters:
        colour - Original colour to be manipulated
        data - Binary data to be inserted into the colour
        position - The position in the colour's 8 bit representation we are considering
        Returns:
        Updated colour

        Parameters:

        data - Binary data to be inserted into the colour
        position - The position in the colour's 8 bit representation we are considering
        Returns:
        Updated colour

      • updateColoursPVD

        public int[] updateColoursPVD(int firstColour,
                              int secondColour,
                              int d,
                              int d1)
        Inserts data into two colours by modifying their difference
        Parameters:
        firstColour - First colour to be manipulated
        secondColour - Second colour to be manipulated
        d - The difference between the colours
        d1 - The new difference calculated from the data to be inserted
        Returns:
        Updated colours
